intro: Pimpinella tirupatiensis, commonly known as the Tirupati pimpernel, is a rare flowering plant native to the Western Ghats of India. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes plants like carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its umbellate inflorescence. The plant has finely divided, feathery leaves that are aromatic and often used in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is adapted to the specific climatic conditions of its endemic region. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species.
